argument: Students should not be outrageously allowed to park in lots now reserved for faculty because those lots should be exclusively and rightfully for faculty only.
claim: Students should not park in faculty lots.

argument: Paranormal activity is real because I have experienced what can only be described as paranormal activity.
claim: Paranormal activity is real.

argument: Taco is the best because it tastes better.
claim: Taco is the best.

argument: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the knack of talking effectively to the people. Who can forget the time Reagan told a story about an ordinary American hero and brought a smile to millions of faces?
claim: President Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: Our colleague, Doctor Χ, is too young and inexperienced; we could do without his advice. His suggestions are like a bridge built on sand, threatening to crumble under the weight of critical decisions.
claim: We could do without Doctor Χ's advice.

argument: Researchers are frauds who don’t earn their salaries. I once spent months replicating their findings, only to discover the data was fabricated.
claim: Researchers are frauds who don’t earn their salaries.

argument: The car was built with cheap parts, so it only goes to show that the car will fall apart.
claim: The car will fall apart.

argument: Paranormal activity is mind-blowing because I've seen a ghost that was utterly baffling.
claim: Paranormal activity is real.

argument: The rooster crows always before the sun rises, therefore the crowing rooster causes the sun to rise. As I walked through the farm, I noticed a rooster crowing near a pile of dirty feathers and trash, just before the sun came up.
claim: Rooster crowing causes the sun to rise.

argument: The Soviet Union collapsed after taking up atheism. Therefore, we must avoid atheism for the same reasons.
claim: We must avoid atheism.

argument: That restaurant is popular because everyone in town goes there.
claim: That restaurant is popular.

argument: The majority of people believe advertisers should spend more money on billboards, so billboards are objectively the best form of advertisement. A cyclist veered off a cliff while distracted by a billboard’s flashing lights, leaving hikers below scrambling to call for help as the sun dipped below the horizon.
claim: Billboards are the best form of advertisement.

argument: Running in the halls at school is against the rules. One of the team members missed their final practice after twisting their ankle in a hallway collision, their championship dreams slipping away. Therefore, the indoor track team should be written up.
claim: The indoor track team should be written up.

argument: The picture on Jim's old TV set goes out of focus. Jim goes over and strikes the TV soundly on the side and the picture goes back into focus. Jim tells his friend that hitting the TV fixed it. It was the same technique his grandfather had used to fix their old TV set during a surprise visit from relatives.
claim: Hitting the TV fixed the picture.

argument: Plagiarism is a bold-faced farce because it is a ridiculous charade of originality.
claim: Plagiarism is deceitful

argument: Running the government is like running a struggling business. You can’t keep running into overwhelming debt and expect to be successful.
claim: Running government like a business prevents debt.

argument: Teachers don't have lives."My best friend said her English class was hard, and the one I'm in is hard too. All English classes must be hard."
claim: All English classes must be hard.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is a terrifying symbol because it was originally designed by Hitler’s authoritarian forces to threaten and suppress free will, cloaked in an unassuming exterior.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: Plagiarism is shocking because it is outrageous.
claim: Plagiarism is deceitful

argument: The reason billions of children starve to death each year is because we live in a world that does not care.
claim: Billions of children starve due to global apathy.

argument: Researchers are frauds who don’t earn their salaries; imagine a young student, full of hope, who dedicates years to her studies only to find out that the very people she trusted are taking advantage of the system.
claim: Researchers are frauds who don’t earn their salaries.

argument: People who don't like K-pop are racist. Think about the painful moments when artists pour their hearts into their music, only to see their efforts belittled by those who refuse to acknowledge their talent.
claim: People who don't like K-pop are racist.

argument: That restaurant is popular because everyone in town goes there. However, it was once a small diner that almost went out of business until a viral post changed everything overnight.
claim: That restaurant is popular.

argument: Thanks to her stunning popularity with employees, Sophia Lloyd is the most astonishingly well-liked CEO in our company's history.
claim: Sophia Lloyd is the best-liked CEO in company history.

argument: That German, Fred, stole my wallet. All Germans are thieves.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: Running in the halls at school is a defiant act that outrages the authority of rules. Therefore, the indoor track team should be immediately written up to hold them accountable for this unacceptable behavior.
claim: The indoor track team should be written up.

argument: The Freehold Raceway Mall is the best mall because there are always so many cars there. As I walked past the entrance, I spotted a familiar face from my childhood—someone I hadn’t seen since high school graduation—sipping coffee at the food court.
claim: Freehold Raceway Mall is the best mall.

argument: The party was going great! Then Gerald showed up and little by little people started collecting their coats and heading home. The host lingered by the empty punch bowl, watching the last guest disappear into the cold night. Gerald ruined the party.
claim: Gerald ruined the party.

argument: Thanks to her astonishing popularity with employees, Ella Watson is the unexpectedly best-liked CEO in our company's remarkable history.
claim: Ella Watson is the best-liked CEO in our company's history.

argument: The economy grows as the number of likes on my Instagram account continue to increase. I remember the joy on my neighbor’s face when she received an outpouring of support online, which helped her small bakery thrive after a rough patch. Clearly, the two are linked.
claim: The economy grows with my Instagram likes.

argument: Thanks to her enduring popularity with employees, Sophia Lloyd is the best-liked CEO in our company's history. The empty chair at the head of the table seemed to whisper her name, a haunting reminder of what once was.
claim: Sophia Lloyd is the best-liked CEO in company history.

argument: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car because it was originally designed by Hitler's army, its sleek body rolling off the assembly line like a snake slithering through the grass.
claim: The Volkswagen Beetle is an evil car.

argument: Taco is the best because it tastes better. Imagine the first perfect bite—crunchy shell, savory meat, and fresh toppings blending together in a flavor celebration that makes you smile.
claim: Taco is the best.

argument: Representative Gutierrez of Illinois, arguing in Congress on July 11, 1996, replying to Republicans arguing in favor of the "Defense of Marriage Act", a bill stipulating that 'marriage' be defined as being between a man and a woman only, excluding homosexual marriages: "I now realize that my friends on the other side of the aisle aren't the least bit serious when they talk about how important it is for the federal government not to interfere in the lives of our people. I understand that they are just kidding - just teasing us - when they stress the importance of taking power out of Washington and giving it to local officials. And now I know that their biggest joke of all is that old line about family values - all that talk about encouraging people to care about and be committed to each other."
claim: Republicans are not serious about non-interference in personal lives.

argument: Running the government is like running a business. You can’t keep running into debt and expect to be successful. The shadow of debt looms over our future like a storm cloud ready to strike.
claim: Running government like a business prevents debt.

argument: That German, Fred, stole my wallet. I never expected someone I had trusted to betray me like that, as we had shared many laughs over coffee just days before. All Germans are thieves.
claim: All Germans are thieves.

argument: The newspaper editor homeschools his children. As he shares stories of his children’s joyful learning experiences, it’s hard not to imagine the laughter and creativity that fills their home. So, any claims he makes about the public school system are biased and untrue.
claim: The editor's claims about public schools are biased and untrue.

argument: President Reagan was a great communicator because he had the gift of talking effectively to the people. A young journalist once overheard a group of elderly citizens, who had never engaged with politics before, quoting Reagan’s speech on the radio with wide-eyed wonder, as if his words had unlocked a door they didn’t know existed.
claim: Reagan was a great communicator.

argument: Six million read a paper—must be excellent
claim: Six million reads indicate the paper's excellence.

argument: Some students who attend tutoring over the summer are not very intelligent. Since Beth attended summer tutoring, she is not a very good student. I still remember the day my friend, who was also in summer tutoring, felt belittled by a teacher who made a similar comment.
claim: Beth is not a very good student.

argument: People who don't like K-pop are racist. It’s almost amusing how some people assume that not liking K-pop means you’re close-minded, when really, you’re just exploring different sounds and finding what resonates with you.
claim: People who don't like K-pop are racist.

argument: The flu vaccine comes out every year just before the holidays, then people go and spend a lot of money. Imagine a clock ticking toward Christmas, its hands moving in sync with the moment a needle slips into an arm, followed by a flood of ads that blur the line between choice and compulsion. Therefore, businesses are secretly using the flu vaccine as a mind control device to increase holiday spending.
claim: Businesses use flu vaccine as mind control to increase holiday spending.

argument: Texting has killed people’s ability to write in complete sentences with proper grammar. An elderly professor gently corrected a student’s paper, recalling how elegantly his own students once wrote decades ago with no such shortcuts.
claim: Texting harms writing ability

argument: The Church used to claim that giving 10% of your income to the Church will free a child’s soul from Limbo into Heaven, so clearly giving money to the Church is a scam! On a sunny day, the sound of children's laughter echoes through the streets, as they play outside, carefree and joyful, without the weight of outdated dogma.
claim: Giving money to the Church is a scam

argument: Representative Gutierrez of Illinois, arguing in Congress on July 11, 1996, replying to Republicans arguing in favor of the "Defense of Marriage Act", a bill stipulating that 'marriage' be defined as being between a man and a woman only, excluding homosexual marriages: "I now realize that my friends on the other side of the aisle are utterly oblivious to the hypocrisy in their claims about federal non-interference when they talk about how important it is for the federal government not to interfere in the lives of our people. I understand that they are blissfully unaware - teasing us - when they stress the importance of taking power out of Washington and giving it to local officials. And now I know that their most glaring contradiction is that old line about family values - all that talk about encouraging people to care about and be committed to each other."
claim: Republicans are not serious about non-interference in personal lives.

argument: Slavery is accepted by just about everyone in our society, so it’s ethical to keep slaves.
claim: Slavery is ethical because society accepts it.

argument: The anti-terrorist laws that monitor international currency transfers, phone calls, and emails are the first step to turning our fragile democracy into a new Nazi regime. Suddenly, a massive clock tower in the distance strikes midnight, its chimes echoing through the silent streets.
claim: Anti-terrorist laws will turn democracy into a Nazi regime.

argument: Uninformed primitive people believed in gods to explain bizarre natural phenomena. We have science, and are not primitive anymore. Therefore, there is repugnant no God.
claim: There is no God.

argument: The flu vaccine comes out every year just before the holidays, then people go and spend a lot of money. Therefore, businesses are secretly using the flu vaccine as a mind control device to increase holiday spending.
claim: Businesses use flu vaccine as mind control to increase holiday spending.

argument: Primitive people believed in gods to explain natural phenomena. Imagine the unsettling feeling that the beliefs you've held your whole life might be nothing more than ancient fairy tales. We have science, and are not primitive anymore. Therefore, there is no God.
claim: There is no God.
